beans.description:
This (contrived) adaptor does the following...
* reads lines from file named via a system property. * writes to file named in a properties file "example.properties"
It is designed to illustrate using a Spring PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer defined in the adaptor config file.
The important point to note is the use of the "-noprops" flag on the command line. This suppresses any attempt by openadaptor to trigger property substitution by adding a generated PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer directly to the Spring context. In this case we are then entirely reliant on the PropertyPlaceholderConfigurer in the config file itself.
Run it like this...
java -Dinput=input/input.txt org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config configurer.xml -noprops
You need the following in your classpath
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar
Once it is running it will read from the input file and write to the output
